We need to understand there is only one church

ok. this would be it then

rv unsourced change. (The larger figure may well be correct, but there's no call for removing a sourced figure.)
Rectifying Eastern-Europe centrism. Greece isn't in "Eastern Europe" but deserves to be mentioned alongside Eastern Europe (which includes Russia, Ukraine, Belarus but not Greece). Check your atlas.
So are Romania, Macedonia, Ukraine, Moldova, Russia, and Belarus. The list is large, and WP custom is to keep things concise so let's just say Eastern Europe.
Revert. If the article is going to highlight Eastern Europe, then mention should also be made of Greece, Cyprus and Georgia which are also significant places of origin for Eastern Orthodox people.
/* Orthodox churches (churches not in full communion) */ That was not the website of a church

rv -- This is not a list of all possible Orthodox jurisdictions, but rather a reference to those most familiar to English speakers.

rv anon edits -- those communities are really not that large; also, use English terminology on the English WP

rm paragraph for unencyclopedia tone; this is not a theological treatise
